medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain started early in the morning around 3 am, initially in the periumbilical area and then moved. The pain was associated with nausea and vomiting, which were non-bloody. The patient denies fever, chills, diarrhea, and reports the last non-bloody bowel movement was last night.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Castleman disease; previous surgeries include umbilical hernia repair and left lateral neck dissection.
